page.title: 20THE HELM WIND IN DUFTON AREA
page.content: This is a strong wind,very local in effect,which rushes from the fell & can persist for days,thus affecting the growth of crops,especially in the Spring. Because of the Helm the villages are built with their backs to the fell, very few older houses having windows overlooking it.Knowledgeable folk, sensing an easterly wind with a roar above,look upwards & seeing bands of cloud constantly forming above the fell and over the valley,can then confidently say,"The Helm is on". "Helm" is said to be derived from "helmet",& the cloud known as the Helm Bar.{ {THANKS. {This Survey was compiled by Members of {Long Marton Womens' Institute and {their friends,to whom they offer their {sincere thanks.
